title: Contributing to kucoin
text: Use clear, descriptive title. Provide detailed steps reproduce implement. Fill PR template. Include tests documentation. Improve documentation submitting PRs clarifications additions.

title: Contributing to kucoin
text: Use 4 spaces indentation. Use box imports. Prefer base R functions avoid unnecessary dependencies. aim minimise external dependencies, including tidyverse packages. Write clear, efficient, maintainable code. writing async code either use promises async/await syntax. never use pipe operators, instead use method chain promises.
code: # Simulate an asynchronous API call that returns a promise after a delay get_data_async <- function(url) {     promises::promise(function(resolve, reject) {         # Simulate network delay of 1 second         later::later(function() {             resolve(paste("Data from", url))         }, delay = 10)     }) }  # Define an asynchronous main function async_main <- coro::async(function() {     # Await the asynchronous API call     data <- await(get_data_async("http://example.com/api"))     cat("Received:", data, "\n") })  # Kick off the asynchronous main function async_main()  # Process the event loop until all tasks are completed while (!later::loop_empty()) {     later::run_now(timeoutSecs = Inf, all = TRUE) }

title: KucoinAccountAndFunding Class for KuCoin Account and Funding Management — KucoinAccountAndFunding
text: KucoinAccountAndFunding class provides comprehensive, asynchronous interface managing account funding operations KuCoin. leverages coro package non-blocking HTTP requests, returning promises resolve data.table objects logical values. class encompasses wide range functionalities, including account summaries, API key details, spot account types, account lists, ledger records spot margin accounts.

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Comprehensive example demonstrating key methods main_async <- coro::async(function() {   # Initialise the class   account <- KucoinAccountAndFunding$new()    # Get account summary   summary <- await(account$get_account_summary_info())   print("Account Summary:"); print(summary)    # Check spot account type   is_high_freq <- await(account$get_spot_account_type())   cat("Is High-Frequency Spot Account:", is_high_freq, "\n")    # List USDT trade accounts   spot_accounts <- await(account$get_spot_account_list(list(currency = "USDT", type = "trade")))   print("USDT Trade Accounts:"); print(spot_accounts)    # Get ledger for last 24 hours   ledger <- await(account$get_spot_ledger(     list(currency = "BTC", startAt = as.integer(Sys.time() - 24*3600) * 1000),     page_size = 20,     max_pages = 1   ))   print("Recent BTC Ledger:"); print(ledger) }) main_async() while (!later::loop_empty()) later::run_now() } # }

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Comprehensive example demonstrating key methods main_async <- coro::async(function() {   # Initialise the class   additions <- KucoinSpotAddOrder$new()    # Place a limit buy order   order <- await(additions$add_order(     type = "limit",     symbol = "BTC-USDT",     side = "buy",     price = "50000",     size = "0.0001",     clientOid = uuid::UUIDgenerate(),     remark = "Test limit order"   ))   print("New Order:"); print(order)    # Test a market buy order   test_order <- await(additions$add_order_test(     type = "market",     symbol = "BTC-USDT",     side = "buy",     funds = "10",     clientOid = uuid::UUIDgenerate()   ))   print("Test Order:"); print(test_order)    # Place batch orders   order_list <- list(     list(       clientOid = uuid::UUIDgenerate(),       symbol = "BTC-USDT",       type = "limit",       side = "buy",       price = "30000",       size = "0.00001",       remark = "Batch buy"     ),     list(       clientOid = uuid::UUIDgenerate(),       symbol = "ETH-USDT",       type = "market",       side = "sell",       size = "0.01"     )   )   batch_result <- await(additions$add_order_batch(order_list))   print("Batch Orders:"); print(batch_result) }) main_async() while (!later::loop_empty()) later::run_now() } # }

title: KucoinSpotStop Class for KuCoin Spot Trading Stop Orders — KucoinSpotStop
text: stop order conditional order triggers market limit order market price reaches specified stopPrice. Key uses include: Loss Limiting: Sell asset price drops threshold (e.g., sell BTC $48,000 falls $50,000). Breakout Trading: Buy asset price rises past resistance level (e.g., buy BTC $52,000 breaks $51,000). Risk Management: Automate exits entries without constant monitoring. KuCoin supports two types: limit stop orders (specifying price size) market stop orders (executing market price size funds).

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Comprehensive example demonstrating key methods main_async <- coro::async(function() {   # Initialise the class   stop <- KucoinSpotStop$new()    # Place a limit stop order   order <- await(stop$add_stop_order(     type = "limit",     symbol = "BTC-USDT",     side = "buy",     stopPrice = "49000",     price = "50000",     size = "0.00001",     clientOid = "stop_test_001",     remark = "Test Stop"   ))   print("New Stop Order:")   print(order)    # Retrieve order details by orderId   details <- await(stop$get_stop_order_by_order_id(order$orderId))   print("Stop Order Details:")   print(details)    # Cancel the order by orderId   canceled <- await(stop$cancel_stop_order_by_order_id(order$orderId))   print("Canceled Order IDs:")   print(canceled)    # List all stop orders   order_list <- await(stop$get_stop_order_list(     query = list(symbol = "BTC-USDT", pageSize = 10)   ))   print("Stop Order List:")   print(order_list) }) main_async() while (!later::loop_empty()) later::run_now() } # }

title: Add OCO Order (Implementation) — add_oco_order_impl
text: OCO (One-Cancels--) order sophisticated trading tool pairs limit order (secure profits) stop-limit order (cap losses). one order executes—either hitting profit target stop-loss threshold—automatically canceled. particularly useful : Risk Management: Set stop-loss limit potential losses market moves position, e.g., buying BTC $50,000 stop $48,000. Profit Taking: Lock gains target price without constant monitoring, e.g., selling $55,000 buying $50,000. Volatile Markets: Automate trading decisions fast-moving conditions, reducing emotional bias ensuring discipline. example, trader might place OCO order buy BTC $50,000, setting limit sell $55,000 (profit) stop-limit sell $48,000 (loss protection). BTC reaches $55,000, profit secured, stop cancels; drops $48,000, losses limited, limit cancels.

title: Add Stop Order (Implementation) — add_stop_order_impl
text: endpoint allows users place stop order KuCoin Spot trading system, triggers market price reaches specified stopPrice. Two types stop orders supported: Limit Stop Order: Executes specified price triggered, requiring price size. Market Stop Order: Executes market order triggered, requiring either size funds. maximum number untriggered stop orders per trading pair one account 20. function validates parameters based order type ensures compliance KuCoin API constraints.

API Request: Sends POST request KuCoin API 3-second timeout. Response Processing: Parses response, validates success, returns data.table orderId clientOid.

title: Construct Request Headers for KuCoin API — build_headers
text: Retrieve Server Time: Obtains current server timestamp milliseconds calling get_server_time() base URL get_base_url(). Construct Prehash String: Concatenates timestamp, uppercase HTTP method, endpoint, request body. Generate Signature: Computes HMAC-SHA256 signature prehash string using API secret, base64-encodes . Encrypt Passphrase: Signs API passphrase API secret using HMAC-SHA256 base64-encodes result. Assemble Headers: Constructs headers httr::add_headers(), including KC-API-KEY, KC-API-SIGN, KC-API-TIMESTAMP, KC-API-PASSPHRASE, KC-API-KEY-VERSION, Content-Type.

what: What is an OCO Order and Batch Cancellation?
title: Batch Cancel OCO Orders (Implementation) — cancel_oco_order_batch_impl
text: OCO (One-Cancels--) order pairs limit order (e.g., secure profits) stop-limit order (e.g., cap losses), canceling one executes. Batch cancellation OCO orders useful : Portfolio Cleanup: Remove OCO orders symbol (e.g., "BTC-USDT") specific IDs market conditions longer favor strategy. Risk Adjustment: Cancel multiple OCOs unexpected volatility avoid unintended triggers (e.g., canceling BTC-USDT OCOs flash crash). Strategy Overhaul: Reset OCO orders across trading pairs implement new trading plan without manual intervention. example, OCO orders BTC-USDT sell $55,000 (profit) $48,000 (stop-loss) anticipate breakout, batch canceling prevents premature execution.

what: What is a Stop Order and Batch Cancellation?
title: Batch Cancel Stop Orders (Implementation) — cancel_stop_order_batch_impl
text: stop order conditional order triggers market limit order specified price (stop price) reached, commonly used : Loss Limiting: Sell asset price drops threshold (e.g., sell BTC $48,000 falls $50,000). Breakout Trading: Buy asset price rises past resistance level (e.g., buy BTC $52,000 breaks $51,000). Batch cancellation allows cancel multiple stop orders , useful : Portfolio Adjustment: Clear stop orders symbol (e.g., "BTC-USDT") market conditions shift unexpectedly. Strategy Reset: Cancel outdated stop orders across multiple pairs IDs refining trading plan. Risk Management: Remove pending stops high volatility avoid unintended triggers (e.g., canceling stops ETH-BTC flash crash). example, stop orders $48,000 $47,000 BTC-USDT anticipate rally, batch canceling prevents premature sales.

title: Get Closed Orders (Implementation) — get_closed_orders_impl
text: keys List; API configuration parameters get_api_keys(). Defaults get_api_keys(). base_url Character string; base URL KuCoin API. Defaults get_base_url(). symbol Character string; trading pair symbol (e.g., "BTC-USDT"). Required. side Character string; optional filter order side: "buy" "sell". type Character string; optional filter order type: "limit" "market". startAt Numeric; optional start time milliseconds. endAt Numeric; optional end time milliseconds. limit Integer; number orders per page (1 100, default 20). max_pages Numeric; maximum number pages fetch (default Inf).

title: Get Closed Orders (Implementation) — get_closed_orders_impl
text: Promise resolving data.table columns: id (character): Unique order ID. clientOid (character): Client-assigned order ID. symbol (character): Trading pair. opType (character): Operation type. type (character): Order type ("limit" "market"). side (character): Order side ("buy" "sell"). price (character): Order price. size (character): Order size. funds (character): Order funds. dealSize (character): Filled quantity. dealFunds (character): Filled funds. remainSize (character): Remaining quantity. remainFunds (character): Remaining funds. cancelledSize (character): Canceled quantity. cancelledFunds (character): Canceled funds. fee (character): Handling fees. feeCurrency (character): Fee currency. stp (character NA): Self Trade Prevention strategy. timeInForce (character): Time force. postOnly (logical): Post-flag. hidden (logical): Hidden order flag. iceberg (logical): Iceberg order flag. visibleSize (character): Visible size iceberg orders. cancelAfter (integer): Seconds cancellation GTT. channel (character): Order channel. remark (character NA): Order remarks. tags (character NA): Order tags. cancelExist (logical): Indicates cancellation record. tradeType (character): Trade type. inOrderBook (logical): Whether order book. tax (character): Tax information. active (logical): Order status (false closed orders). createdAt (numeric): Creation timestamp (milliseconds). lastUpdatedAt (numeric): Last update timestamp (milliseconds). createdAtDatetime (POSIXct): Creation time UTC. lastUpdatedAtDatetime (POSIXct): Last update time UTC.

title: Get Closed Orders (Implementation) — get_closed_orders_impl
text: endpoint fetches closed orders (canceled fully filled) given trading pair (e.g., "BTC-USDT"). orders returned descending order based last update time. function handles pagination using lastId parameter fetch multiple pages results, data availability limited last 72 hours default time range specified beyond period.

title: Get Closed Orders (Implementation) — get_closed_orders_impl
text: Parameter Validation: Ensures symbol valid trading pair limit integer 1 100. Request Construction: Builds API endpoint query parameters including symbol, side, type, startAt, endAt, limit. Authentication: Generates private API headers using build_headers() GET method endpoint. API Request: Sends asynchronous GET requests fetch pages closed orders orders returned max_pages reached. Response Processing: Combines fetched orders single data.table adds createdAtDatetime lastUpdatedAtDatetime columns using time_convert_from_kucoin().

title: Get Closed Orders (Implementation) — get_closed_orders_impl
text: code: String (required) - Response code ("200000" indicates success). data: Object (required) - Contains: lastId: Integer (required) - ID next page data. items: Array objects (required) - List closed orders, fields: id: String - Unique order ID. clientOid: String - Client-assigned order ID. symbol: String - Trading pair. opType: String - Operation type. type: Enum - Order type: "limit" "market". side: Enum - Order side: "buy" "sell". price: String - Order price. size: String - Order size. funds: String - Order funds. dealSize: String - Filled quantity. dealFunds: String - Filled funds. remainSize: String - Remaining quantity. remainFunds: String - Remaining funds. cancelledSize: String - Canceled quantity. cancelledFunds: String - Canceled funds. fee: String - Handling fees. feeCurrency: String - Fee currency. stp: Enum - Self Trade Prevention: "DC", "CO", "CN", "CB" NA. timeInForce: Enum - Time force: "GTC", "GTT", "IOC", "FOK". postOnly: Boolean - Post-flag. hidden: Boolean - Hidden order flag. iceberg: Boolean - Iceberg order flag. visibleSize: String - Visible size iceberg orders. cancelAfter: Integer - Seconds cancellation GTT. channel: String - Order channel. remark: String NA - Order remarks. tags: String NA - Order tags. cancelExist: Boolean - Indicates cancellation record. tradeType: String - Trade type. inOrderBook: Boolean - Whether order book. tax: String - Tax information. active: Boolean - Order status (false closed orders). createdAt: Integer - Creation timestamp milliseconds. lastUpdatedAt: Integer - Last update timestamp milliseconds.

title: Retrieve Historical Klines Data (Implementation) — get_klines_impl
text: base_url Character string; base URL KuCoin API. Defaults get_base_url(). symbol Character string; trading pair (e.g., "BTC-USDT"). Defaults "BTC-USDT". freq Character string; candlestick interval (e.g., "15min"). Allowed values: "1min", "3min", "5min", "15min", "30min", "1hour", "2hour", "4hour", "6hour", "8hour", "12hour", "1day", "1week", "1month". Defaults "15min". POSIXct object; start time data retrieval. Defaults 24 hours now. POSIXct object; end time data retrieval. Defaults now. concurrent Logical; whether fetch segments concurrently (default TRUE). Caution: May trigger rate limits. delay_ms Numeric; delay milliseconds request (default 0). retries Integer; number retry attempts per segment request (default 3). verbose Logical; whether print progress messages (default FALSE).

title: Retrieve Historical Klines Data (Implementation) — get_klines_impl
text: Promise resolving data.table containing: datetime (POSIXct): Converted timestamp. timestamp (numeric): Raw timestamp seconds. open (numeric): Opening price. close (numeric): Closing price. high (numeric): Highest price interval. low (numeric): Lowest price interval. volume (numeric): Trading volume. turnover (numeric): Trading turnover.

title: Retrieve Historical Klines Data (Implementation) — get_klines_impl
text: Input Validation: Converts POSIXct ensures earlier . Frequency Conversion: Translates freq seconds using frequency_to_seconds(). Segmentation: Splits time range segments split_time_range_by_candles(), 1500 candles. Segment Fetching: Creates promises segment via fetch_klines_segment(). Execution Mode: Fetches segments concurrently promises::promise_all() concurrent = TRUE, sequentially otherwise. Aggregation: Combines segment results data.table::rbindlist(), removes duplicates timestamp, orders datetime.

text: Parameter Validation: Ensures symbol valid trading pair orderId provided. Validates optional parameters. Request Construction: Builds endpoint URL query parameters. Response Processing: Parses response, converts items array data.table, adds createdAtDatetime column.

title: Get Trade History (Implementation) — get_trade_history_impl
text: Endpoint: GET https://api.kucoin.com/api/v1/hf/fills Domain: Spot API Channel: Private API Permission: General Rate Limit Pool: Spot Rate Limit Weight: 2 SDK Service: Spot SDK Sub-Service: Order SDK Method Name: getTradeHistory Official Documentation: KuCoin Get Trade History

title: Get Trade History (Implementation) — get_trade_history_impl
text: symbol: String (required orderId provided) - trading pair symbol (e.g., "BTC-USDT"). orderId: String (optional) - unique order ID. provided, parameters (except lastId, limit, startAt, endAt) ignored. side: Enum (optional) - Order side: "buy" "sell". type: Enum (optional) - Order type: "limit" "market". lastId: Integer (optional) - ID last fill previous batch pagination. limit: Integer (optional) - Number fills per page (1 100, default 20). startAt: Integer (optional) - Start time milliseconds. endAt: Integer (optional) - End time milliseconds.

title: Get Trade History (Implementation) — get_trade_history_impl
Get Trade History (Implementation) — get_trade_history_impl
text: Content Type: application/json

title: Get Trade History (Implementation) — get_trade_history_impl
text: code: String (required) - Response code ("200000" indicates success). data: Object (required) - Contains: lastId: Integer (required) - ID last fill current batch. items: Array objects (required) - List fill details, : id: Integer - Fill ID. orderId: String - Order ID. counterOrderId: String - Counterparty order ID. tradeId: Integer - Trade ID. symbol: String - Trading pair. side: Enum - "buy" "sell". liquidity: Enum - "taker" "maker". type: Enum - "limit" "market". forceTaker: Boolean - Whether order forced take liquidity. price: String - Fill price. size: String - Fill size. funds: String - Funds involved fill. fee: String - Handling fees. feeRate: String - Fee rate. feeCurrency: String - Fee currency. stop: String - Stop type (currently empty HFT). tradeType: String - Trade type. taxRate: String - Tax rate. tax: String - Tax amount. createdAt: Integer - Fill timestamp milliseconds.

title: Place Order (Shared Implementation) — place_order_helper
text: shared helper function placing orders testing order placement KuCoin Spot trading system. handles parameter validation, request body construction, authentication, API request sending, response processing.

title: Place Order (Shared Implementation) — place_order_helper
code: place_order_helper(   keys = get_api_keys(),   base_url = get_base_url(),   endpoint,   type,   symbol,   side,   clientOid = NULL,   price = NULL,   size = NULL,   funds = NULL,   stp = NULL,   tags = NULL,   remark = NULL,   timeInForce = NULL,   cancelAfter = NULL,   postOnly = NULL,   hidden = NULL,   iceberg = NULL,   visibleSize = NULL,   .__coro_env_parent__ = <environment> )

title: Place Order (Shared Implementation) — place_order_helper
text: keys List; API configuration parameters get_api_keys(), including: api_key (character): KuCoin API key. api_secret (character): KuCoin API secret. api_passphrase (character): KuCoin API passphrase. key_version (character): API key version (e.g., "2"). Defaults get_api_keys(). base_url Character string; base URL KuCoin API. Defaults get_base_url(). endpoint Character string; API endpoint use (e.g., "/api/v1/hf/orders" "/api/v1/hf/orders/test"). type Character string; order type: "limit" "market". Required. symbol Character string; trading pair (e.g., "BTC-USDT"). Required. side Character string; order side: "buy" "sell". Required. clientOid Character string; unique client order ID (recommended UUID, max 40 chars). Optional. price Character string; price limit orders (must align priceIncrement). Required limit orders. size Character string; quantity limit market orders (must align baseIncrement). Required limit, optional market. funds Character string; funds market orders (must align quoteIncrement). Optional market, mutually exclusive size. stp Character string; self-trade prevention strategy: "CN", "CO", "CB", "DC". Optional. tags Character string; order tag (max 20 ASCII chars). Optional. remark Character string; order remarks (max 20 ASCII chars). Optional. timeInForce Character string; time--force strategy: "GTC", "GTT", "IOC", "FOK". Optional, defaults "GTC". cancelAfter Integer; cancel n seconds (GTT). Optional. postOnly Logical; passive order flag (disabled IOC/FOK). Optional, defaults FALSE. hidden Logical; hide order order book. Optional, defaults FALSE. iceberg Logical; show visible portion iceberg orders. Optional, defaults FALSE. visibleSize Character string; max visible quantity iceberg orders. Optional.
